DataElement.preferredName: Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Intervention or Procedure Prior To Protocol Agent Occurrence Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response that indicates the patient meets the eligibility requirements for participation in a clinical trial with regards to interventions or procedures prior to study treatment.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Intervention or Procedure Prior To Protocol Agent Occurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria._An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects._Earlier in time or order._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._A medical product, practice, or application that is tested in a clinical trial._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Property.preferredName: Intervention or Procedure Prior To Protocol Agent Occurrence
Property.preferredDefinition: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:Earlier in time or order.:Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.:A medical product, practice, or application that is tested in a clinical trial.:An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

Concepts.definition: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
A medical product, practice, or application that is tested in a clinical trial.
An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Have at least 28 days elapsed
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have at least 28 days elapsed from the last dose of systemic anti-cancer treatment (cytotoxic, biologic or immunotherapeutic) or radiation therapy (except for palliative radiation, in which case a 14-day washout applies) prior to initiating study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior systemic anti-cancer therapy (chemotherapy, targeted therapy, immunotherapy, biologic therapy, or vaccine therapy) within the 3 weeks preceding the first dose of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received chemotherapy, targeted therapy, or immunotherapy within 3 weeks of study entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had chemotherapy, immunotherapy, or external radiotherapy within 4 weeks prior to entering the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has not received radiotherapy, was last dose of chemotherapy at least 21 days prior to randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received prior systemic anti-cancer therapy, has there been a washout period of at least 3 weeks from chemotherapy or 5 half-lives from oral targeted drugs before the start of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have adequate treatment washout period before study treatment, defined as: Major surgery greater than or equal to 4 weeks, radiation therapy greater than or equal to 3 weeks, palliative radiation greater than or equal to 2 weeks, systemic therapy greater than or equal to 3 weeks and in case of investigational drug use greater than or equal to 2 weeks or 5 half-lives, whichever is longer?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had chemotherapy, radiotherapy or other KS directed therapy other than ART for HIV within 2 weeks before the initiation of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: If tumor lysis is present prior to therapy has it been treated prior to start of therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had any anti-cancer therapy within 14 days (or 5 half-lives, whichever is longer) prior to the first dose of the investigational products?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the patient is undergoing diagnostic workup and is likely to begin an Appendix A therapy, can fresh tissue be obtained as part of a standard of care procedure prior to starting the Appendix A therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was last dose of chemotherapy at least 21 days prior to enrollment (provided the patient did not receive radiotherapy)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient been off enzalutamide or phenobarbital for at least 5 weeks, and 3 weeks for other agents prior to starting olaparib?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has any prior therapy been completed greater than or equal to 4 weeks, or greater than or equal to 5 half-lives of the prior agent (whichever is shorter) prior to enrollment on protocol?
